C

camera - Variable in class main.Controller
 
camera - Variable in class renderer.Renderer
 
Camera - Class in renderer
The Camera class which creates the camera through which we see our Image object and which creates Rays for our Renderer.
Camera(Vector3D, Vector3D, Vector3D, double, double) - Constructor for class renderer.Camera
Creates a new Camera object with the specified, origin(position), target, targetUpDirection, fieldOfView and aspectRatio.
color - Variable in class renderer.SceneObject
 
Color - Class in utilities
The Color class is used to give the SceneObjects a color.
Color() - Constructor for class utilities.Color
The empty constructor of the Color class sets the rgb values to zero so it returns the color black.
Color(float, float, float) - Constructor for class utilities.Color
This Color constructor needs three float values and sets the corresponding fields.
Color(Color) - Constructor for class utilities.Color
This Color constructor needs another Color object and uses it to copy all the fields to this new Color object.
Controller - Class in main
The Controller class which controls the whole application and the only way from which we can interact with the Renderer class through the main method.
Controller() - Constructor for class main.Controller
Create a new Controller object which also creates an Options object with default parameters.
createRay(double, double) - Method in class renderer.Camera
The createRay method is used to create a new Ray object with the Camera's origin as it's own origin and uses the values that were calculated in the Camera's constructor to calculate the Ray's direction.
cross(Vector3D) - Method in class utilities.Vector3D
The cross method calculates the cross product of this Vector3D object and the Vector3D object given as a parameter.
